TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IMetadataExchange

Docs.summary: Exposes methods used to return metadata about a service.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When programming [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] services, it is useful to publish metadata about the service. For example, metadata can be a Web Services Description Language (WSDL) document that describes all of the methods and data types employed by a service. Returning metadata about an [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] service allows consumers of a service to easily create clients for the service. For more information about [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] metadata endpoints, see [Metadata](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/metadata.md).
Services implemented using [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] publish metadata by exposing one or more metadata endpoints. Metadata endpoints in [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] have an address, a binding and a contract like any other endpoint. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataReference> interface specifies the service contract implemented by all metadata endpoints in [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)].
There is no need to implement the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataReference> contract in your service implementation. Instead, add the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceMetadataBehavior> to the service description.
Or, when using configuration, set the `contract` attribute of the endpoint element to `IMetadataExchange`. For an example, see [How to: Publish Metadata for a Service Using a Configuration File](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/how-to-publish-metadata-for-a-service-using-a-configuration-file.md).
For details on publishing metadata in [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] see [Publishing Metadata](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/publishing-metadata.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public IAsyncResult BeginGet (System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message request, AsyncCallback callback, object state);

Docs.param: A that should be processed to determine the metadata to return.
An that points to the method that will process the metadata.
Any data which allows the caller to determine which asynchronous call is being returned.
Docs.summary: Starts an asynchronous retrieval of metadata.
Docs.returns: An that can be passed to the method.

Docs.param: An that contains data used to further process the metadata.
